results.title: The Man who planted trees (K)
results.creator_credit: Radio Canada, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Frederic Back
results.brief_description: Another award winning title by Frederic Back, creator of the prize winning animated film CRAC, who is showcased in this new half hour film which pays tribute to a man whose toil and dedication brought life to a barren, desolate region high in the French Alps. A triumphant testament to one man’s indomitable spirit. “The Man Who Planted Trees” is a thought provoking tale, a visually stunning tour de force, from a genius in the fine art of animated cinema. Winner of more than 25 awards, including Academy Award, 1988. Narrated by Christopher Plummer and based on a story by Jean Giono.

results.title: The Man who loves frogs: Mike Tyler
results.brief_description: One man’s look at the enormous variety of frog species found in Australia, the differences between them, and the ways each has adapted to its own particular lifestyle/environment.

results.title: The Man who loved machines
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Verrall and Sidney Goldsmith
results.brief_description: A humorous, animated science film that introduces students to the nature of energy and energy conservation, as well as to the second law of thermodynamics, entropy. The points are underscored by the observations of an all-seeing dog in need of a doghouse, whose master, though obsessed with machines, is finally convinced that the simplest tool is sometimes the most energy-efficient! Voice and Narration by Terrence Labrosse. Music by Peter Mendieta.

results.title: The Man who knew too much: the secret agent
results.creator_credit: Gaumont, Sir Michael Balcon and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: This tape contains two classic Hitchcock tales, ‘The Man who knew too much’ (1934), and ‘The Secret agent’ (1936). In ‘The Man who knew too much’, a child is kidnapped by spies to ensure his silence, but he springs into action. There are memorable sequences in the film involving a dentist, an East End mission and the Albert Hall. This film was later remade by Hitchcock in America, but the earlier version is more acclaimed. Peter Lorre is excellent as the sneering villain. Cast also includes Leslie Banks and Edna Best. In ‘The Secret agent’, the scenario is an ambiguous one of double identity and meaning. Brodie (Geilgud), is a British novelist turned spy who travels to Switzerland under an assumed name. With him is his fictional wife, (Madeline Carroll), and an eccentric hired assassin known as “The General”, (Peter Lorre). Their mission is to find and kill a German spy, but first they must guess who he is. Based on the novel “Ashenden” by Somerset Maugham, ‘Secret Agent”, has many features of the quintessential Hitchcock.

results.title: The Man who had no dream
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Nick Bosustow and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: Animated story based on the book by Adelaide Holl about an idle man who discovers meaning in his life through activity and caring for others. Narrated by Jacques Aubuchon. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Man who digs for fish
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Taylor and Jack Long
results.brief_description: Frank Jenkinson, eighty-two, has been digging for fish for twenty-five years. His unorthodox conservationist practices have increased the numbers of the salmon population in the Jarvis Inlet from a modest 500 to 25000. Using a spade and accompanied by his dog, Frank wades up and down the stream, digging for the newly hatched salmon that lie buried in the gravel. Without his intervention they risk dying before reaching maturity.

results.title: The Man who cried
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Christopher Sheppard and Sally Potter
results.brief_description: Fegele (Christina Ricci) is a young girl living in a small Russian village with her father who decides to leave for America, promising to send for her as soon as he is able. Nazi troops arrive at the village, forcing Fegele to flee to England with relatives where she is adopted by a loving couple who rename her Suzie. An aspiring and gifted singer, Suzie leaves for Paris where she becomes a nightclub singer and meets Lola (Cate Blanchett). The girls commence work on a lavish opera production where Suzie meets Cesar (Johnny Depp), a poor gypsy horse trainer, and Lola meets Dante (John Turturro), the star of the opera whom she uses for his wealth and security. Suzie and Cesars short lived romance comes to an end with the Nazi occupation of France. Sally Potter, director of ‘The Tango lesson’ and ‘Orlando’ provides a lush and lavish film depicting the heartbreaking world of two souls destined for anguish.

results.title: The Man who can't stop
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Richard Mason and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: Tells of the efforts of Francis Sutton to save the Australian coastline from pollution. Dedicated to this task Sutton works ceaselessly on maps, diagrams and plans in an attempt to find an alternative to the disposal of sewage through ocean outfalls. Though receiving many rebuffs, gradually he is gaining support, from a scientist, politician and from the people who live around him. Cinematography by Don McAlpine.

results.title: The Man who came to dinner
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Hal B Wallis and William Keighley
results.brief_description: While on a lecture tour an acid-tongued celebrity (Whiteside) and his secretary accept a dinner invitation from the Stanleys. Unfortunately on arriving at the Stanley’s home, Whiteside slips on the ice and breaks his hip subsequently finding himself confined to the Stanley’s home. During his recuperation Whiteside manages to cause chaos and mayhem with his interfering and upsetting comments. Based on the Broadway hit by George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart, and adapted for the screen by Julius and Philip Epstein. Cast includes Bette Davis, Ann Sheridan, Monty Woolley, Jimmy Durante, Billie Burke, Reginald Gardiner.

results.title: The Man that gravity forgot
results.creator_credit: Coronet, Auricom Van Gelber and Wijnand Nieuwenkam
results.brief_description: An animated film about the life of Bram, the only person in the world who is not affected by the force of gravity. As Bram narrates this account of his gravity-free life he presents basic scientific information about gravity, and reveals the important role that this force plays in our lives.
